content:
here says

"For ECDSA public keys, each JWK SHALL include crv, x, and y values (curve, x-coordinate, and y-coordinate, for EC keys)"

Is "ECDSA" a typo?

No. We have an explicit requirement for ES384 support; that's

ECDSA using P-384 and SHA-384

(See https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc7518#section-3.1)
Is there a different term that you would find clearer?
NVM. I thought it would be "ESA" then found out there is not such name.
